results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, TV Ed Productions, Bendigo Education Resource Centre and Brendan Kenworthy
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.

results.title: Current and electromotive force
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
Explains the electron theory, discussing arrangement of molecules, building up of current conductors, electromotive force, resistance and chemical and mechanical sources of electromotive force.

results.title: Currajong: a different way (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Steve Thomas Video Productions and Steve Thomas
results.brief_description: A look at Currajong Primary School, an establishment catering for “intelligent underachievers”. Describes its unique approach to working with kids who have failed in all kinds of schools.

results.title: Curly Top (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fox Film Corporation, Winfield Sheehan and Irving Cummings
results.brief_description: Since the death of their parents, Mary Blair and her little sister Elizabeth have been inmates of a private orphanage. Mary promised her dying mother that she and Elizabeth, nicknamed “Curly Top” would never be separated. With a natural talent for singing and dancing Curly Top is a mischievous yet appealing child. Elizabeth gets into trouble during a visit of the trustees, one of them, a playboy bachelor is taken with her and decides to adopt her. The bachelor soon discovers Mary is part of the ‘deal’ and this leads to some embarrassing and often funny predicaments. Stars Shirley Temple, John Boles, Rochelle Hudson and Jane Darwell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fox Film Corporation, Winfield Sheehan and Irving Cummings

results.title: Curious George rides a bike
results.brief_description: Based on the story by H.A. Rey with his illustrations, this animated film tells of the droll adventures, pranks and triumphs of a monkey called George when he is given a push bike for a present.

results.title: Curious George (Captioned)
results.brief_description: George, that irrepressible monkey, is living happily in the jungle when he is discovered by the man in the yellow hat and whisked off on a series of adventures on land and sea. George’s curiosity gets him into a lot of trouble, but produces many laughs along the way.

results.title: Curious George
results.brief_description: The mischievous exploits of Curious George the monkey in a delightful puppet animation adapted from the book of the same title by H.A. Rey. George is brought from the wilds of the jungle to the sophistication of the city and experiences a few mishaps along the way.

results.title: Curiosity show!: bag of tricks
results.brief_description: Entertaining and challenging compilation of simple experiments and science tricks from “The Curiosity Show”, many of which can be attempted in the classroom or at home. Written and presented by Rob Morrison and Deane Hutton.
